solution_line_template: Three times the sum of marbles that Atticus, Jensen, and Cruz have is equal to {total_sum_multiplied_by_three}, meaning together they have {total_sum_multiplied_by_three}/{multiplier}=<<{total_sum_multiplied_by_three}/{multiplier}={total_marbles_all_three}>>{total_marbles_all_three} marbles.

If Atticus has half as many marbles as Jensen, and Atticus has {atticus_marbles} marbles, Jensen has {ratio_atticus_to_jensen}*{atticus_marbles}=<<{atticus_marbles}*{ratio_atticus_to_jensen}={jensen_marbles}>>{jensen_marbles} marbles.
Together, Atticus and Jensen have {jensen_marbles}+{atticus_marbles}=<<{jensen_marbles}+{atticus_marbles}={atticus_jensen_total}>>{atticus_jensen_total} marbles.

Since the sum of marbles that Atticus, Jensen, and Cruz have is equal to {total_marbles_all_three}, and Atticus and Jensen have {atticus_jensen_total} marbles, Cruz has {total_marbles_all_three}-{atticus_jensen_total}=<<{total_marbles_all_three}-{atticus_jensen_total}={cruz_marbles}>>{cruz_marbles} marbles.
